reviews.review: Love the game, hate the matchmaking

Don't get me wrong, i kind of like this game. 
But the description is totally wrong. This is not a "horror" movie.
You'll play as a survivor and try to do max point by trolling, using broken mechanism and bug abuse. If you have friend, you can play with them and break the game even more. Voice chatting will give you huge advantage. 
As a killer, you're not supposed to kill the survivor, just play with them. If you managed to kill 4 of them in less than 2 minutes for exemple, you'll get less reward than just playing. Have you ever seen  an horror movie where survivors just teabagging the killer behind a window?  
Matchmaking is totally broken, you'll play with zero perks against people who have multiple perks. Killer will dodge, and as survivor you'll have to find another game (this is REALLY annoying)
Because of clipping, some killer may able to see you behind tree/rocks. 

Like someone already said " killers and survivors calling the other side op without understanding the potential from playing the other side."
This is because of the rank system, and childish player

If this is ok for you, you'll enjoy the game. 
Pro:
-The devs seems to listen
-Majority of time it's quite fun. 
-You'll shit your pants as a survivor (at least the first game! )
-Web system (progression system) is really nice. 

Buy this game only if you're ok with the ranking/farming point system, don't expect a "horror movie" game.

Кавказский шашлык

Ингредиенты 3,5 кг баранины 6 луковиц 70-80 мл растительного масла половина лимона 4-5 ч.л. соли молотый черный перец по вкусу (примерно 15-20 горошин или 1 ч.л. молотого) несколько веточек тимьяна 1 ч.л. молотой паприки 2 лавровых листа 2/3 ч.л. молотого кориандра 0,5-1 ч.л. сушеного базилика щепотка красного острого перца щепотка зиры

Рецепт приготовления блюда в домашних условиях 
 Баранину тщательно промыть и насухо обтереть салфетками, порезать крупными кусочками примерно одинакового размера. Горошины перца тщательно растолочь в ступке. Сложить мясо в миску, добавить соль, перец, все специи и перемешать. Луковицы очистить и порезать кольцами, толщиной по 0,5 см. Лавровый лист мелко поломать, добавить к мясу вместе с луком и растительным маслом.  Из лимона выжать весь сок и процедить его через сито, влить его в миску с маринованным мясом, быстро помешивая его ложкой. Накрыть мясо тарелкой, поставить гнет коло 2-3 кг и убрать в холодильник на ночь. Спустя 10-12 часов можно приступать к приготовлению кавказского шашлыка: нанизать кусочки мяса на шампуры, чередуя их с кольцами лука. Жарить шашлык на мангале над тлеющими углями примерно полчаса. При этом периодически переворачивать шампура и поливать мясо оставшимся маринадом. Подавать шашлык из баранины к столу горячим, с любым соусом и гарниром на ваш вкус. Приятного аппетита!

This game is pretty fun, I have yet to play it with friends but after watching various playthroughs on streams I think it would add a new level of excitement. The game is essentially Minecraft but with new skins and some different mechanics. There is a lot of tedious resource gathering with stone, wood, clay and other materials. The other thing I don't particularly enjoy are the nights lengths if you're playing the base game without adjusting settings, cowering for long periods of time is pretty boring despite understanding why they make you do it. I really enjoy the way this game goes about with status effects and adds a layer of depth that effects the way that people spend their time. The main draw to this game is surviving the hordes that attack every 7 nights, the difficulty which ramps up in scale as the game progresses. The various types of zombies you encounter are relatively interesting despite being used in other games, and it's fun to deal with some of the random groups that roam the world occasionally. Overall I would recommend this game, it has some flaws but not enough of them to make the gameplay unbearable.

Glitchy, but fun. Frustrating at times, but also exhilarating. The EXP/grind curve is a bit on the long side, and both killers and survivors have some cheesy tactics at times (mostly survivors), but the game is fun to watch and play.

Wo fange ich am Besten an, ich glaube das Spiel hat durchaus Potential,
hier mal eben einige positive wie auch negative Anmerkungen

Positiv (Überlebender): 
- 4 Charaktere die unterschiedliche Perks bekommen können.
- Dinge wie eine Karte, Werkzeugkoffer, Medikit (das aussieht wie eine Lunchbox) 
  und eine   Taschenlampe, tragen definitv zum Spielspaß bei.
- Das Spiel läuft flüssig, die Karten sind gut durchdacht.
- hindernisse die der Spieler runterschmeißen kann behindern den Killer enorm.
- Es gibt einige Updates in letzter Zeit, heißt das Spiel wird auf jedenfall suportet.
 
Positiv (Killer) :
- Es gibt 3 verschieden Killer mit unterschiedlichen Perks und unterschiedlichen Methoden,
  die Überlebenden nieder zu strecken.
- Killer können die runter gefallenen Barrikaden zerstören.
- Die Killer können die Überlebenden aufspüren sobald sie rennen.
- Der rote Strahl aus den Augen der Killer verursacht (zumindest bei mir) Schweißausbrüche.


Negativ (Überlebender) :
- Durch den letzten Patch sind einige hindernisse wegenommen wurden.
- Die Barrikaden die runter fallen behindern einen oft selbst da der Spieler ab und zu mal wieder
  zurück glitcht.
- Es war anfangs ziemlich unbalanced heißt der Killer hat einen so gut wie immer gesehen, getroffen,   getötet.

Negativ (Killer) :
- Der Unsichtbare Killer braucht (mir) deutchlich zu lange um sichtbar zu werden
  und zuschlagen  zu können.
- Der Killer kann durch Fenster durchschlagen was auf Dauer (zumindest für mich) 
  ziemlich lame wird,
  da man damit so gut wie alle töten kann.

Abschließend noch einige Anmerkungen zu Bugs etc., die Lobby Suche buggt und braucht oftmals zu lange um ein Spiel zu finden.
Mitspieler helfen einem deutlich seltender als ich erwartet hätte, die Killer stehen teilweise einfach nur 
vor ihrer gefangen Beute am Haken, so dass man kaum bis keine Chance hat denjenigen zu befreien.
Der Killer ist immer schneller als der Spieler.
Die Spieler die am Haken hängen haben den Haken oftmals oberhalb der Schulter, also nicht sehr sauber gearbeitet von den Entwicklern.

So, dass waren einige Eindrücke des Spiels ich könnte noch Stundenlang so weiter machen aber das wäre nicht 
sachdienlich.
Ich für meinen Teil denke, dass die 20 € sich lohnen da das Spiel ja noch weiter gepatcht wird mehr als 20 € würde ich allerdings zum derzeitigen Stand des Spiels aber auch nicht dafür ausgeben. 

Danke für eure Aufmerksamkeit und eure Zeit hoffe ich konnte einigen bei der Entscheidung helfen. :)
バグはあれどあまり気にはなりません。直してくれればなお良し

Здравствуй баги, лаги, читеры - я пришел к вас с приветом. Денег свои не стоит эта игра, даже со скидкой. До сих пор, ох уж эти шалунские повешивание людей на крюки - порой глюки настолько суровые, что любой челябнский метеорит развернётся и улетит куда подальше. Не могу поверить, что я это говорю, но античит от Vavle и то лучше работает, здесь его видимо в 2020 году походу не завезли. Обожаю стабильную халтуру и вечные DLC с новыми убийцами. Я это запускать не буду, но многие до сих пор жалуются на провалы с оптимизацией, а также работа над балансом опять же плачет где-то в сторонке. Задумка, вроде как и хорошая, а вроде хочется сказать NO и поставить 1 кривой крюк из 10.

P.S. 2021 году я вернулся и меняю на положительный обзор. Играть с друзьями весело и если не воспринимать это, как нечто серьёзное, то вполне можно получить кайф. Но я все равно не стану удалять верхний негативный обзор, ведь баги, лаги, читеры никуда не исчезли, но их гораздо меньше, когда я пригорел на максимальную.

Не рекомендую данный товар к покупке.
1)Балансировка игры отсутсвует и по началу игры вы будите встречаться с игроками намного сильнее вас.
Это вызвано наличием способностей открывающихся на определенном уровне персонажа и которые будут постоянно попадаться вам в бой.
2)Одинаковые карты и отсутствие генератора расположения ключевых точек.
Игра превращается в побегушки по кругу и быстро надоедает.
3)Невозможность добавления игроков в друзья .
Вы не сможите добавить попавшихся игроков в друзья или отправить им запрос (Игрой не предусмотренно)
4)Поиск матча от 5 до 25 минут.
5)Разработчики не предусматривали индивидуальнгые очки развития персонажей и сделали общие и таким образом вероятность найти бывалого игрока ( с меньше чем 300 часов игры ) на стоковом чаре низка. Так как5 они набивают очки на основных и переносят на новых и пропадает интерес с индивидуальному развитию.
6)Скорость маньяков очень низка и их анимации очень долгие ( Переход через окна и т.д слишком долгие)
7)У персонажей есть все (Откаченных) и им не нужны предметы на карте так как безлимитные аптечки и самовостановление убивает понятия слово -ВЫЖИВАНИЕ .
8)Длительность смерти-гибели персонажа от рук маньяка на виселице составляет 195 секунд.И вы не можете покинуть его ! Так как его освободят независимо от остатка здаровья за 1.5 секунды. 
9)Крюки и ловушки выжившие легко могут обезвред.
10)Оптимизация - Полностью отсутсвует ( При наличии хорошей видео карты и качественного процессора все равно лагает amd asus r9 290x i74790 все равно лагает .

I'm a casual gamer and this is my most played game on Steam. I can recommend it.

First, I have to admit that there are some annoying issues: Matchmaking as a survivor can take a while. Especially so, if you want to team up with friends. Also, there are some bugs/glitches, but I only encountered two that were actually problematic. The rest of the time it's just graphics, e.g., the hook not actually touching my character as I'm supposedly hanging there.

Now, what I really like in this game is that the mechanics are rather basic. As a survivor you sneak around and try to repair generators, which triggers some quick-time events but is otherwise rather easy. The killer on the other hand looks for the survivors, downing them in two hits and trying to sacrifice them to an "entity".

There are some items that help the survivors, but they are very well balanced, as they are by no means necessary. Same goes for the perks that enhance the survivors' and killers' abilities. They are (mostly) useful, but not necessary. The main factor deciding whether you win or lose is you personal skill and a tad of luck.

What I really wonder is why some people here play the game for 50 or more hours and then call it bad. If they didn't like the game they wouldn't have spent more than two days playing the game, so they're either lying or dumb. I agree that waiting to find a game can be annoying, but for me, and apparently for most other people here, the thrill of being hunted relentlessly is well worth the wait.

For me, the breaking point of recommending a game is if I have more than one hour of fun for each buck I spend. This is definitely the case!

As a survivor main to anyone who wants to play survivor I wouldn't recommend this game. Killers seem to be the developer’s favorite. 
The lobby system to get a game if you play with friends is horrible. I waited with friends for 2 hours and we only got 2 short games in that time with about 5 killers dodging the lobby once we finally got in. It’s such a huge time waster and they still haven’t fixed it.
They have said it’s more about us hiding than escaping yet they give killers like the Wraith an item that lets them see us through walls…. The new killer Nurse is going to have a passive to see our breathing and get a sign where we are and she will also be able to see us once she has hit us once from a good distance. She will also have a ridiculous passive to slow the speed down to which we fix generators, heal ourselves/others and sabotage hook/traps if people get hooked. Because of this we might see hook camping becoming more of a thing. Hook camping is beyond a joke and makes the game so boring and over for you once you’re hooked.
The new survivor Nea that is coming with the Nurse has the worst perks and is now the worse survivor even below the one called Dwight who people had said was the worse till now.
The devs just seem so out of touch with survivors and I see a lot of survivors getting over it and quitting. I know my friends and I are at that point.

The last review I left for this game was set to not recommended because the game had MANY issues with playing online. At the time I had 216 hours and after a long hiatus I returned and have bumped my hours to 500. This game has changed a LOT for the better. Bigger variety in killers, builds, and maps. The issues with both the meta and online connection have improved significantly. 

There are still problems, however. Naturally in a PvP game, some killers will be much much stronger than others but it does feel like some killers seem to be steamrolling the meta and leaving some of my favorite killers in a rather poor state that makes them hard to have fun with.

You will meet toxic and frustrating players for both killers and survivors, especially at higher ranks. But overall the game is still tons of fun especially with friends.

The only grudge I have with the game is that there is truly no incentive to reach the higher ranks and the game is actually more fun at lower ranks unless you like to play very competitive and sweaty matches very often.

Past that the game is fun, exciting, allows for a lot of replay, allows for different styles of play, and has many aspects of the game that you can always improve on if you choose to!

This game has potential and can be good somtimes, but right now it's a mess.

To start off, finding a match takes forever. I sit with my friend in a lobby only to get "Match could not be found" Over and over again. Sometimes it boots us back to the main screen which gets really annoying. There's also tons of bugs in the game. I was hooked and I couldn't struggle because I kept teleporting all over the place and kept getting tossed around. Another bug is sometimes you will get stuck on something which just makes you an easy target for the killer, same with you being stuck in the "Carry" animation for when a killer picks you up. Running around like that just shows the killer where you are all the time and makes it so you can't hide. 

I could keep going on but what's the point? Like I said it has a ton of potential but right now it's a broken game that's for some reason titled as released. It's hard to believe the Beta had less bugs, no lag and no problems.

Prepare for a long read... this one is for those who do thorough research before buying:

There's something about this game that keeps me playing it. I'm not a survival horror fan at all, but DbD it's fun, exhilarating, scary, and even funny at times. 
I like the game, I really do, it's not perfect, but it's been keeping me engaged since the day I bought it. Yes, it has bugs, yes I died countless times, more than the times I have survived. I basically suck, but I still play. The only issue I have is the players themselves. That doesn't bode well when it comes to a pvp game.

I'll be honest, in the forums, everyone complains, rather loudly, about anything that you can imagine. The killers and survivors, both call each other out. Killers complain that survivors are OP and that they abuse infinites (if you buy, you'll find out soon enough what that is...) and survivors complain that killers are OP and camp all the time. Then there's those that complain about the developers not fixing bugs, and that the game itself is riddled with bugs. 

Honestly, if you're pretty chill and just care about having fun, you'll do just that, have fun. Just don't take everything to heart and if you can't stand all the salt thrown around, simply stay away from the forum and participate in discussions that are pretty tame or show that a degree of civility. 
So far, I've not experience thanks-for-ruining-my-experience-I-will-never-play-this-again bugs. Yes, I've got stuck in certain parts of the map a couple of times, and got "failed to join game" countless times, my game even crashed once and people disconnect from the matches be it because things are not going as they planned or just internet issues. 

I can't speak for those who want to play the game with friends, but as a solo player, despite failing to join games several times, I can get into a lobby pretty quickly. 
There's also the problem of killers dodging lobbies when they see a high rank survivor, but I hear that's being addressed. In my opinion, that's not the game's fault, people have to stop worrying about pips and ranks so much. 

I pretty much made the game sound terrible, but trust me, I think it's worth it. You'll find really good matches where the killer gives the survivors a good chase and where the survivors work as a team, save each other, and avoid the killer like the plague. In others, you might not get so lucky, but that's the point; you can't win them all. The maps are random and no match is the same as the other (unless everyone's farming for points, then you can just simply do what you have to do and leave as soon as possible). The killer is basically the one that sets the pace of the game, so survivors have to adapt to his/her playstyle if they want to survive. If you are fair and don't exploit certain mechanics, the game can be great and loads of fun for everyone playing, even if you’re not playing with your friends. 
If you just want to whack people with butcher knives, chainsaws, weird makeshift skull weapons, trap them with bear traps, hang them on hooks as a sacrifice to your spider demon, or simply enjoy the thrill of terrorizing survivors, go for it and buy it. 

If you want to fix generators, save people, run away from maniacs trying to kill you, successfully stun them with pallets from time to time, sneak around and think that the killer might be possibly blind for not seeing you there crouching there in the grass in front of him, also go for it and buy it. 
For hardcore gamers, I might not have played the game that much, but I’m looking forward to spending more time in it. I believe that the game has some interesting concepts and that those $20 is a fair price. 

P.S: I you get easily upset and can’t stand losing, several times, I wouldn’t recommend this game to you. Play fair, don’t falsely accuse because you lost a game, and this’ll be a happier community.

Ten Stars

Honestly not worth it if you don't have a group to play with.

The game has several features that NEED to be done to help balance it out.

1.) some way to communicate between survivors, yes this makes things difficult for the monster, but not terribly so, especially when the monster easily earns 11K in game XP in one match even if they lose.

2.) BALANCE THE FUCKING MATCHMAKING. Played this game for all of 4 hours and grew to despise it. Why? Because there is some seriously stupid things that happen. Like getting placed with high level people that have large numbers of high level perks unlocked, and you dont even get to start with lube for your butthole.

3.) BALANCE SPAWN LOCATIONS. First four games, literally the first four I played, I spawned right next to the monster and died.

These are just a few of the issues I have with this game, however, I dont care to even bother trying to play anymore and getting a more rounded feeling about the game. Entirely because it feels lazily put together, with no good documentation for people to read up to determine how the game works, and absolutely no way to work together as a team.

I thought that I would enjoy it more if I played as the monster, but, alas, that too was wasted as I was once again beaten multiple times by VERY high level players. When I mean high level, I mean I'm starting as a lvl 1 monster going against three lvl 25+ and maybe 1 level >14 survivors. I lost all of those matches, but I still got points because the game is stupid.

One final thing, a lot of the controls/movements in the game are done to deliberatly make things harder. Which is an interesting idea in and of itself. However when implemented, it means that unless you beat your face against the brick wall for countless hours you will not have fun.

Though this is all my experience playing solo, and I dont think any game like this should be only fun when played with a group of friends. I should be able to play on my own and have a good game, which I have only had on rare occasions ( x=>5 where x=games had fun in).

Maybe when I have time I'll try to give it another chance, but so far I'm rather furious at this game and wouldn't recommend anyone buying it unless they have a group of friends they intend to only play it with.

This game is quite fun. It's not as scary as it looks, just a really fun basic concept that keeps you hooked for hours on end (pun intended). There are quite a few bugs and glitches, but the dev team responds fairly quickly to the issues the community presents. They have dev streams every thursday as well. And new content comes about every month.
It's ok I guess

Ich weiß gar nicht warum alle so nörgeln... Das Spiel funktioniert doch. Klar gibt es mal einen Bug aber das vielleicht in einem von 50 Spielen... Keine Ahnung wie viele Leute an dem Spiel arbeiten, doch das komplette Team hat meinen Respekt verdient. Niemand hat damit gerechnet das Dead by Daylight soo gut bei den Leuten ankommt und, dass es so einen großen Ansturm/Hype gibt. Und dann haut das Team in kurzer Zeit Patches raus mit neuem Killer und Survivor und allem Möglichen. Einfach klasse, dass sie da mithalten können :) Zum Thema Lobbys: Online-Lobbys funktionieren meiner Meinung nach recht gut. Freunde-Lobbys: Da muss am Match-Making gearbeitet werden aber ich bin mir zu 98% sicher, dass dies in den nächsten Patches gefixt wird :)  Und zum Thema "Boar scheiß Community ey digga" : Spiel doch das nächste Mal besser, dann musst du auch nicht von deinen ach so dummen Mitspielern gerettet werden und du kannst dein eigenes Ding machen :)   Kann ich das Spiel für diesen Preis empfehlen: Aufjedenfall :)

Now I don't expect anyone to read this, but there's some things I need to let out. One, there should be some motivation NOT to camp a hook as the killer, because it just makes the game... well, not as fun. Nothing is worse than a killer camping a hook... except: Two, once you get off of a hook, the killer can hit you down again instantly, it happens to me too often, but maybe I'm just really unlucky. Those are the only two complaints I have, and still love this game and love playing it, I even love watching it be played. In the end I think it's a great game, and hope something is done about these, I will still play if it doesn't, and I don't really care if it isn't. If you've actually made it this far, thanks for reading me be an idiot while talking about a game. (And I do recommend this game, it's fun, buy it if you can.) Bye!

I love this game, I really do. I like the concept of the 4 v 1 game where you have to work together to survive. And yet I'm uninstalling it because of the matchmaking system.

A game like this should be challenging, but not discouraging. This game is the latter and I feel impossible for latecomers to get into. If you don't already have 300 plus hours in this by now, you don't have much of a chance to get into it.

If I play survivor, I'm going up against either a killer who will sit and camp your body, or I have a selfish team who lead killers to me or let me die. Or both, both happen more often than not. And there isn't a punishment for letting a killer sit and stare you in the eye while you bleed out.

If I play killer, I'm going against survivors who have ten times my play time on record, and have unlocked all the overpowered perks and put them on their character. The fact you can teach the ability to heal, run fast and destroy hooks to one person, rather than letting each character grow into a speciality build, is what ruins the game. Teachable perks just should not exist. I get the point is to experiment with builds but everyone just chooses the same three perks as survivor and unless you're a killer with at least four perks, you don't have much of a chance. I don't want to camp your body, I want to hunt people down, and I can't because my hooks are gone, you heal behind an infinite wall and you've been playing far longer than me.

Matchmaking should not be based on rank, it should be based on character level or number of hours a person has in a game. And expressing an opinion on this game gets you labelled salty. The community to this game is honestly, one of the worst I have ever experienced because both sides claim the other is overpowered. So I'm retiring this game because I'm tired of getting pissed off at both my teammates and the people I play against. I have better things to get hacked off at.

I know there is a new update tomorrow but unless it's going to put me against other people with 40 hours in game so I have a chance, I'm not interested. I want to play this game, and I love the idea of it, and it is fun when it works, but the broken matchmaking system means I can't go against people of a similar level, and it's no fun going against people I don't have a chance with. I didn't dodge lobbies because I want to learn how to play well, but now I just don't want to play because it's always against a team I can't even hope to compete against.

Devs, please listen to the community and fix matchmaking. We don't need new content, we need a fighting chance.
